the user doesn't have Blockstack installed on their machine. If this
is not specified, the current default in this library will be used.

`null`, the core node specified by the user or default core node
will be used.

comment.shortText:
Generates a name preorder transaction.
First step in registering a name. This transaction does not reveal the name that is
about to be registered. And it sets the amount of STX to be burned for the registration.
comment.text: Resolves to the generated StacksTransaction

comment.shortText:
Generates a namespace preorder transaction.
First step in registering a namespace. This transaction does not reveal the namespace that is
about to be registered. And it sets the amount of STX to be burned for the registration.
comment.text: Resolves to the generated StacksTransaction

comment.shortText:
Generates a ready namespace transaction.
Final step in namespace registration. This completes the namespace registration and
makes the namespace available for name registrations.

Second and final step in registering a name.

This renews a name registration.

comment.text:
# @stacks/cli

Command line interface to interact with auth, storage and Stacks transactions.

## Installation

```
npm install @stacks/cli
```

## Usage

See [documentation](https://docs.blockstack.org/references/stacks-cli)

children.name: error
children.defaultValue: 'Caught exception sending transaction or zone file'

comment.shortText:
Load the config file and return a config dict.
If no config file exists, then return the default config.

tags.text: (string) the path to the config file.
(sring) 'mainnet', 'regtest', or 'testnet'

comment.text:
# @stacks/common

Common utilities used by Stacks.js packages.

## Installation

```
npm install @stacks/common
```

# @stacks/encryption

Encryption functions used by Stacks.js packages.

## Installation

```
npm install @stacks/cli
```

comment.shortText: Specify encryption options, and whether to sign the ciphertext.

String encoding format for the cipherText buffer.
Currently defaults to 'hex' for legacy backwards-compatibility.
Only used if the `encrypt` option is also used.
Note: in the future this should default to 'base64' for the significant
file size reduction.
Encrypt the data with the public key corresponding to the supplied private key
Encrypt the data with this key.

If set to `true` the data is signed using ECDSA on SHA256 hashes with the user's
app private key. If a string is specified, it is used as the private key instead
of the user's app private key.

tags.text: false

comment.shortText:
Specifies if the original unencrypted content is a ASCII or UTF-8 string.
For example stringified JSON.
If true, then when the ciphertext is decrypted, it will be returned as
a `string` type variable, otherwise will be returned as a Buffer.

String encoding format for the cipherText buffer.
Currently defaults to 'hex' for legacy backwards-compatibility.
Only used if the `encrypt` option is also used.
Note: in the future this should default to 'base64' for the significant
file size reduction.

If set to `true` the data is signed using ECDSA on SHA256 hashes with the user's
app private key. If a string is specified, it is used as the private key instead
of the user's app private key.

tags.text: false

comment.shortText:
Specifies if the original unencrypted content is a ASCII or UTF-8 string.
For example stringified JSON.
If true, then when the ciphertext is decrypted, it will be returned as
a `string` type variable, otherwise will be returned as a Buffer.
Optional function to generate cryptographically secure random bytes

children.name: NO_CRYPTO_LIB

type.value: Crypto lib not found. Either the WebCrypto "crypto.subtle" or Node.js "crypto" module must be available.

children.defaultValue: 'Crypto lib not found. Either the WebCrypto "crypto.subtle" or Node.js "crypto" module must be available.'

comment.shortText:
Decrypts data encrypted with `encryptContent` with the
transit private key.

comment.text: encrypted content.

the hex string of the ECDSA private
key to use for decryption. If not provided, will use user's appPrivateKey.

comment.shortText: Encrypts the data provided with the app public key.

comment.text: data to encrypt

# @stacks/keychain

Create and manage keys/wallets for the Stacks blockchain.

## Installation

```
npm install @stacks/keychain
```

# @stacks/profile

Functions for manipulating user profiles.

```
npm install @stacks/profile
```

SingleSigHashMode - hash160(public-key), same as bitcoin's p2pkh
MultiSigHashMode - hash160(multisig-redeem-script), same as bitcoin's multisig p2sh

MultiSigHashMode - hash160(segwit-program-00(public-keys)), same as bitcoin's p2sh-p2wsh

The transaction MUST be included in a microblock
The transaction MUST be included in an anchored block
